column4: NobleComm: I don't know what could be the problem, there should be a message there
NobleComm: it should be preceded by a WW
NobleComm: or you're using another configuration file, or another log file, or you didn't check with enough precission, that's all I can tell you, but could be perfectly something else.
I don't know how you can do it, but I've had that problem and checking in monitorworld and setting up things correctly was the solution
but I guess that's not your problem
than I can't help you more, I just recommend you check very carefully the settings
ifconfig
VividHaZe: ifconfig
you are welcome
well, is there a way to do it at all?
When I'm entering my IP address so I can share files do you use the inet address or the Broadcast address?
VividHaZe: you want to access a computer?
if that's the case you use IP
broadcast is for sending packages to every machine in the network
No I'm setting up NFS and I need to enter the location of the file...wait...gah i'm stupid brb
well in that case you use IP
or hostname if you have a correct /etc/hosts
explain more precisely please, the computer is booted from network or the iso is in a network?
then you must first mount the partition holding the iso file
ssh, telnet or rsh work but I think its not the correct solution, you should use smbmount (samba) or NFS
you must mount it
see the documentation of smbmount
